title: MySQLMAX()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLMAX()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Find the price of the most expensive product in the "Products" table:
SELECT MAX(Price) AS LargestPrice FROM Products;

Definition and Usage
The MAX() function returns the maximum value in a set of values.
Note:
See also the
MIN()
function.
Syntax
MAX(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. A numeric value (can be a field or a formula)
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: SELECT MAX(Price) AS LargestPrice FROM Products;

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLMAX()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLMAX()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLMAX()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
